thread.title: Attorney General Hilgers Announces Over $1.2 Million in Recoveries for Consumers in 2025
thread.title_full: Attorney General Hilgers Announces Over $1.2 Million in Recoveries for Consumers in 2025

title: Attorney General Hilgers Announces Over $1.2 Million in Recoveries for Consumers in 2025
text:
Nebraska- Attorney General Mike Hilgers announced yesterday of the successful recovery of $1.2 million for consumers throughout 2025. These recoveries are the instances where consumers lost money to a business or a scam, with the Consumer Affairs Response Team (CART) successfully facilitating the return of those funds to the consumer. CART works on engaging with Nebraska businesses and consumers to facilitate a voluntary resolution of customer complaints, working in the Nebraska Attorney General’s Office on behalf of Nebraskans. In previous years, CART recovered over $1 million.
Complaints and scam reports to the Attorney General’s Office can include imposter scams, home repairs, identity theft, auto issues, and online shopping. Consumers can connect with CART for one – on-one support by filing a complaint on ProtectTheGoodLife.Nebraska.gov or by calling the Attorney General’s Office at (402) 471-2785. A complaint form is also available by mail. Free education materials and presentations are also available from the Nebraska Attorney General’s Office, which is dedicated to proactively educating consumers on how to protect their personal finances and data.
summary: Nebraska- Attorney General Mike Hilgers announced yesterday of the successful recovery of $1.2 million for consumers throughout 2025. CART works on engaging with Nebraska businesses and consumers to facilitate a voluntary resolution of customer complaints, working in the Nebraska Attorney General’s Office on behalf of Nebraskans. Complaints and scam reports to the Attorney General’s Office can include imposter scams, home repairs, identity theft, auto issues, and online shopping. Consumers can connect with CART for one – on-one support by filing a complaint on ProtectTheGoodLife.Nebraska.gov or by calling the Attorney General’s Office at (402) 471-2785.
